Headlines: Sensex, Nifty Fell The Most In Two Weeks As HDFC Bank, Reliance Drag: Market Wrap
Description:
India's benchmark stock indices fell the most in two weeks on Wednesday, led by losses in HDFC Bank Ltd., ICICI Bank Ltd., and Reliance Industries Ltd.

Nifty ended below the 19,700 level, while Sensex closed under 65,900, the lowest levels since Oct. 9. On a single-day basis, the indices dropped the most since Sept. 28, 2023. Banks and non-banking financial companies fell, whereas the pharma and auto sectors advanced.

Headlines: HDFC Bank Q2 Results Review- NIM Declines As Guided Earlier; Lower Credit Costs Aid Profitability: Nirmal Bang
Description:
HDFC Bank Q2FY24 results were better than our expectations, with net interest income/pre-provision operating profit/profit after tax coming in at a variation of 0.8%/-1.2%/8.4% versus our estimates. 

Based on a like-to-like comparison, the bank’s loan growth stood strong at 17.6% YoY. Deposit growth also was robust at 18.2% YoY. As expected, due to the impact of incremental cash reserve ratio and excess liquidity at the time of merger, NIM declined to 3.6% (interest earning assets) as against the bank’s guidance of 3.7- 3.8% NIM post-merger.

Headlines: HDFC Bank Q2 Review - PAT Beat, NIM Disappoints; Building In Only A Gradual Rise In NIM: ICICI Securities
Description:
Despite higher-than-estimated profit after tax at Rs 159.8 billion (4% beat), HDFC Bank Ltd.’s Q2 FY24 results were a tad softer, as net interest margin (at 3.4% of total assets) was weaker-than-expected (net interest income miss at ~6%). 

 
We value the stock at ~2.5 times FY25E ABV and thus arrive at our target price of Rs 1,750. 

We now rate the stock as 'Add' (versus 'Buy' earlier). 

Key risks would be slower-than-estimated loan growth as well as NIM.

Headlines: HDFC Bank Q2 Results Review - Close To The Bottom: Systematix
Description:
HDFC Bank Ltd. reported earnings of Rs 159 billion (51% YoY, 34% QoQ), above our and consensus estimate of Rs 141 billion, led by lower provisions and higher other income. 

With respect to the merged HDFC Bank plus Housing Development Finance Corporation Ltd., the key highlights for the quarter were:

advances growth of 5% QoQ with the decline in eHDFC’s non-individual portfolio expected to have stabilised,

 

While reported net interest margin (as % of assets) declined 70 bp QoQ to 3.4%, the core NIM

Headlines: HDFC Bank Q2 Results Review: High Liquidity To Keep Net Interest Margin Soft
Description:
The excess liquidity in HDFC Bank Ltd. after the merger with Housing Development Finance Corp. is likely to keep its net interest margin lower, according to analysts. 

While the bank management has spoken of a 25-basis-point impact on the margins, Nomura Global Markets Research expects a recovery of about 13 basis points over a period of time. "On the other hand, the NIM drag from the I-CRR requirement is transient and should disappear in ensuing quarters," it said.

Headlines: HDFC Bank Q2 Results Review - Margin Trajectory To Improve: Prabhudas Lilladher
Description:
HDFC Bank Ltd. saw good quarter; net interest margin was 4 basis points higher to our estimate at 3.66% and core pre-provision operating profit was a 2.9% beat owing to better fees. 
 
With core return on asset of 1.74% and likely core profit after tax compound annual growth rate of ~19% over FY24-26E, HDFC Bank  remains our preferred pick among large-caps. 

We maintain multiple at 2.8 times on Sep-25E core adjusted book value and target price at Rs 2,025. Retain ‘Buy’.

The lender's net profit rose 50.6% year-on-year to Rs 15,976 crore, compared to Rs 10,605 crore a year ago. The profit beat the Bloomberg estimate of Rs 14,120 crore.

Headlines: HDFC Life Q2 Results Review - Market Share In HDFC Bank Surprises Positively: Yes Securities
Description:
Calculated post-merger VNB margin grew by 10 bps QoQ (comparable) but de-grew -71 bps YoY  

VNB: The post-merger VNB growth was 31.3% QoQ  

APE: The post-merger APE was Rs 30,450 million up by 30.8%QoQ (comparable) and 6.8% YoY  

Expense control: Post-merger expense ratio decreased -10 bps QoQ to 19.8% as opex ratio decreased -237 bps QoQ but comm. ratio increased by 228bps QoQ.
We value HDFC Life at 3.1 times FY25 prcie/embedded value for an FY24E/25E/26E return on embedded value profile of 18.9%/19.3%/19.7%

Headlines: HDFC Life Q2 Review - Business Reorientation Towards Higher Volume Growth Is A Positive: ICICI Securities
Description:
We like HDFC Life Insurance Company Ltd. from a volume execution perspective, considering stable margins and market share. There is a tailwind of higher growth in bancassurance (600 basis points increase in parent bank channel QoQ), while business reorientation of agency/partnership channels towards beyond-tier-I locations is a strategic priority (underlined by the Exide Life acquisition, addition of 37,000 agents in H1, tie-ups with Bandhan Bank Ltd./Small finance banks). 

 

Maintain 'Buy'. Risks include overall weakness in volume growth.

Headlines: Aditya Puri Joins Deloitte As Senior Advisor
Description:
Aditya Puri, former chief executive officer of HDFC Bank Ltd., has joined Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu India LLP as a senior advisor.

“Puri will leverage his unparalleled expertise and experience to help drive a tech-enabled transformation in the financial services sector and champion initiatives aimed at boosting financial inclusion across India,” Deloitte said in a statement.

Headlines: HDFC Bank Q2 Update: CASA Ratio Dips 780 Basis Points On Mega Merger
Description:
HDFC Bank Ltd.'s CASA ratio stood at 37.6% as of Sept. 30, falling 780 basis points compared to 45.4% a year ago.

Sequentially, the CASA ratio fell 490 bps from 42.5% on the backdrop of the mega merger with Housing Development Finance Corp, according to an exchange filing on provisional figures on Wednesday.

However, the deposit growth stayed strong in the second quarter of the financial year, rising 30% year-on-year to Rs 21.7 lakh crore. On a quarterly basis, the deposits were up 14%.

Description:
HDFC Bank Ltd., Power Grid Corp., Shriram Properties Ltd., Trent Ltd. and TVS Motor Co. are expected to see healthy net passive inflows due to rejig of the NSE indices, Nuvama Instiitutional Equities said.

Passive flows are expected in the CPSE, Nifty Bank, Nifty 50 and Nifty Next 50 indices, while probable weight changes and like inclusions and exclusions are expected in the Nifty LargeMidcap 250, Nifty Midcap 150, Nifty Midcap 100 and Nifty Smallcap 100 indices, according to a note on Tuesday.

Headlines: BQ Banking Unlimited: How Banks Can Build On Opportunity From Tech Challenges
Description:

That is the commentary that came from panelists Chief Information Officer Ramesh Laxminarayan of HDFC Bank and Mahesh Ramamoorthy, CIO of Yes Bank - who spoke on the challenges and unveiling the technological advancements in banking at BQ Prime's Banking Summit held in Mumbai on Friday.

Description: Shares of HDFC Bank Ltd. declined as much as 3.82% in early trade on Wednesday, after the management met with sell-side analysts to comment on the financials of its merged entity with HDFC Ltd. and related matters on Monday. The bank shared proforma financial statements for the merged entity for Q1 FY24 and discussed other related matters.

Headlines: Sensex, Nifty fall in early trade on weak global trends ahead of U.S. Fed interest rate decision

Headlines: HDFC Bank Shares Fall As It Expects Asset Quality To Worsen, Margins To Narrow
Description:
Shares of India's largest private bank HDFC Bank Ltd. fell the most in 11 weeks after it is likely to see its bad loan ratios worsen marginally and a compression in net interest margins, according to the analyst meet on Monday.

Gross non-performing asset ratio is likely to increase to 1.4% as of July 1, compared to 1.2% as of June 30, Srinivasan Vaidyanathan, chief financial officer of HDFC Bank told sell-side analysts on Monday.

Headlines: HDFC Bank - NIMs Likely To Decline Near Term Due To Additional Liquidity: ICICI Securities
Description: HDFC Bank Ltd. hosted an analyst meet on September 18, 2023 to update on the opening net worth of the merged entity and related matters. The hit on opening net-worth is slightly higher than our initial estimates and the pressure on near term net interest margin also appears higher than initially envisaged. LDR, as of July 1, 2023, stands at 108%. Q1 FY24 pro forma merged NIM (on total assets) would decline to 3.7-3.8% versus 4.1% for standalone bank.

Headlines: HDFC Bank - Excess Liquidity Impacted Margins: IDBI Capital
Description:
We attended Analyst meet hosted by HDFC Bank Ltd. which highlighted the adjustment for harmonisation on opening networth and Proforma Q1 FY24 merged financials. 

Harmonisation effect of IGAAP alignment, credit policy and deferred tax liability on incoming networth resulted decline in networth to Rs 1,118 billion versus 1,340 billion. 

 excess liquidity on the balance sheet (July 01, 2023 resulted impact of 70 basis points on Housing Development Finance Corporation Ltd.'s net interest margins thus 25-30 bps impact on merged entity.

Headlines: Sashidhar Jagdishan To Continue As HDFC Bank MD & CEO, RBI Approves Re-appointment - News18
Description: Jagdishan joined the Bank in 1996 as a manager in the finance department

Headlines: HDFC Bank Sees Asset Quality Worsening Marginally After Merger
Description:
India's largest private bank HDFC Bank Ltd. is likely to see its bad loan ratios worsen marginally, after the merger with Housing Development Finance Corporation Ltd. 
Gross non-performing asset ratio is likely to increase to 1.4% as of July 1, compared to 1.2% as of June 30, Srinivasan Vaidyanathan, chief financial officer of HDFC Bank told sell-side analysts on Monday. In a presentation, the bank also noted that the net NPA ratio will rise to 0.4%, from 0.3% at the end of the first quarter.

Headlines: RBI approves re-appointment of Sashidhar Jagdishan as MD and CEO of HDFC Bank for 3 years
Description: Sashidhar Jagdishan has been re-appointed as MD and CEO of HDFC Bank till October 26, 2026

Headlines: RBI Allows Sashidhar Jagdishan To Be Reappointed As MD & CEO Of HDFC Bank
Description: The Reserve Bank of India has greenlit the reappointment of Sashidhar Jagdishan as managing director and chief executive officer of HDFC Bank, the lender said in an exchange notice on Tuesday. The approval is for three years and will be effective from October 27, 2023 to October 26, 2026.

Headlines: Sensex, FTSE Rejig: HDFC Bank To See Inflows Of $600 Million, Says Nuvama
Description:
As Sensex and FTSE as scheduled for a rejig on Sept 15, HDFC Bank could see inflows of $ 600 million, according to a Nuvama report.

HDFC Bank will be added in FTSE in three tranches, with each quarter witnessing around $500 million of inflows. While it expects inflows of $102 million from the change in its weight in BSE's benchmark index Sensex as a result of the quarterly rejig.

"When you tally up all the inflows on the same day, HDFC Bank is poised to receive an impressive cumulative inflow of nearly USD 600 million," the note said.

Headlines: Sensex, Nifty Recover Led By Gains In HDFC Bank, Reliance: Midday Market Update
Description:
India's benchmark stock indices recovered after a lower open by midday trade on Wednesday, led by gains in index heavyweights Reliance Industries Ltd. and HDFC Bank Ltd.

Nifty was trading above the 20,000 level, whereas Sensex was above the 67,400 mark. Public sector banks and media stocks rose, while information technology and realty shares remained under pressure

Headlines: Sensex, Nifty Inch Closer To Record Highs As RIL, HDFC Bank Lead: Midday Market Update
Description:
India's benchmark stock indices opened higher and inched closer towards their all-time highs scaled on July 20, 2023. 

While, Nifty 50 was nearly 50 points away from the 20,000 level, Sensex was about 600 points shy of its record high, above the 67,600 mark.

Headlines: A Perfect Storm Has Begun Stifling India’s Bank Credit Growth
Description:
Tight liquidity and higher interest rates are beginning to slow down the credit growth of India's banking sector.

The Reserve Bank of India's incremental cash-reserve-ratio requirement, its dollar sales to buttress a weakening rupee and the goods and services tax outflow are all leading to liquidity turning negative since March 2023.

Non-food bank credit rose 19.7% year-on-year to over Rs 148 lakh crore as on Aug. 11, according to the latest data by the RBI, primarily driven by the merger between HDFC and HDFC Bank Ltd.

Headlines: HDFC Bank Rides On Premium Cards To Grab Market Share
Description: As India's largest private lender, HDFC Bank is working to grab a maximum share of the credit card industry by focusing on premium cards. The bank has partnered with several entities, including Swiggy, Retailio, and IRCTC, to expand its presence in the credit card segment and cater to mass-affluent and middle-income segments. HDFC Bank's cards chief Parag Rao said the move is driven by revenge spending by Indians on both domestic and international travel post-Covid.

Headlines: Tax Query: What Are the Tax Implications on Capital Gains from Selling HDFC Limited Shares After Merger with HDFC Bank?
Description: Issue of HDFC Ltd shares consequent to merger with HDFC Bank is not taxable. If 336 shares are sold at Rs. ₹1,690, long term capital loss of Rs. ₹91,728 can be set-off against long term capital gain. If sold at Rs. ₹2,500, long term capital gain of Rs. ₹1,80,432 is taxable at 10% plus applicable surcharge and cess.

Headlines: Housing Demand Has Power To Unlock Economy’s Potential: HDFC Bank Director
Description:
HDFC Bank Director Keki Mistry, on Wednesday, asserted that the demand for housing will continue in India and it has the power to unlock the potential of the economy.

Speaking at the foundation day celebration of Bandhan Bank, Mistry said the housing sector also generates huge employment and has a better credit risk profile than other segments.

Headlines: ‘The perception that you lend and lose money in villages is incorrect’: HDFC Bank
Description: The perception that you lend and lose money in villages is incorrect and therefore HDFC Bank will remain bullish on rural markets with a goal to serve people in over two lakh villages in India by end of March 2024, said Rahul Shyam Shukla, Group Head – Commercial and Rural Banking.

The BSE Sensex declined 388.40 points or 0.59 per cent to settle at 65,151.02. During the day, it fell by 493.32 points or 0.75 per cent to 65,046.10. The NSE Nifty slipped 99.75 points or 0.51 per cent to end at 19,365.25.

Headlines: HDFC Life to offer dollar-denominated insurance solutions via GIFT City branch
Description: HDFC Life Intl & HDFC AMC Intl launch IFSC branches at GIFT City to offer life & health ins, fund mgmt & advisory sols to NRIs & global Indian diaspora. HDFC Bank's IBU has been present at GIFT City since 2017, offering corporate & treasury sols, trade credit, foreign currency loans & depository services. Low ins & MF penetration in India to be addressed by IFSCs, which will facilitate dev of strong base of int'l financial services, raise bar on efficiency & competitiveness.

Headlines: Sensex, Nifty Trade Lower As HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, RIL Drag: Midday Market Update
Description:
India's benchmark stock indices traded lower through midday on Wednesday, led by losses in HDFC Bank Ltd., ICICI Bank Ltd., and Reliance Industries Ltd.

Metals, non-banking financial companies, and the private banking sectors dragged while information technology and healthcare stocks advanced. On Monday evening, the CPI inflation rose to a 15-month high at 7.44% in July, as compared to 4.87% in June.

Financial markets in India were shut on Tuesday for Independence Day celebrations.

Headlines: Sensex, Nifty fall in early trade on weak global trends, foreign fund outflows
Description: From the Sensex pack, Bajaj Finance, HDFC Bank, IndusInd Bank, Tata Motors, Tata Steel, Bajaj Finserv, JSW Steel and ICICI Bank were the major laggards

Headlines: Banks redeem ₹3,000 crore from liquid schemes for I-CRR compliance
Description: Private sector banks have redeemed Rs 30,000 crore from liquid MF schemes to meet RBI's I-CRR requirement. Quantum AMC's Pathak said banks tap treasury bills & liquid funds for short-term liquidity needs. RBI's I-CRR to absorb surplus liquidity of Rs 1 lakh crore & review on Sept 8. HDFC Bank more sensitive to I-CRR due to post-merger deposits.

ICICI Bank, Hindustan Unilever, Infosys, ITC, Bajaj Finance all saw erosion in their mcap, while Reliance Industries, TCS and SBI added to theirs. Headlines: HDFC Bank CEO Sashidhar Jagdishan raises concerns over funding risk post merger at AGM
Description: He added that the net interest margins (NIM) for the bank will drop September quarter onwards as the mortgage book of Housing Development Finance Corp (HDFC) carries a lower spread.

Headlines: Post merger, HDFC Bank can offer higher credit growth opportunities to the nation, says chairman
Description: HDFC Bank merger with HDFC Ltd. to benefit national economy with higher credit growth, larger financial products & higher flows into affordable housing, agriculture & MSMEs, said Atanu Chakraborty, Part-time Chairman & Independent Director, HDFC Bank Ltd. at AGM. Bank to offer home loan product, low cost of funds & full suite of financial products like life insurance, general insurance, health insurance & investment products.

Headlines: HDFC Bank’s shares surge as FPI ownership hits a record
Description: The latest data indicates a surge, compared to the 32 per cent shareholding recorded in the corresponding quarter of the previous fiscal year. “So, with its relative valuation (compared to other global banks) and growth opportunities in India, HDFC Bank is naturally the top choice for FPIs,” said Kranthi Bathini, Director - Equity Strategy, at WealthMills Securities

Headlines: FPIs’ shareholding in HDFC Bank reaches record high; private banks attract foreign investments
Description: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) increased their stake in HDFC Bank to a record 54% by the end of June 2023, showing strong interest in India’s largest private bank after its merger with HDFC Ltd. Private sector banks, including Yes Bank and IDFC First Bank, witnessed increased FPI investment, reflecting confidence in the sector’s growth and management.

Headlines: HDFC Bank, Swiggy Join Hands To Launch New Credit Card Offering Exciting Benefits - News18
Description: The cashback will be deposited as Swiggy Money to the user’s account which can only be used for transactions across the Swiggy platform.

Headlines: Bank Nifty prediction today – Jul 28, 2023: Higher probability of a fall
Description: Bank Nifty index opens with a gap-down, declines 0.5% during the day. Market breadth is neutral with half of the stocks in green and half in red. Federal Bank gains 1.3%, HDFC Bank loses 1%. Nifty PSU Bank index up 0.4%, Nifty Private Bank index down 0.25%. Bank Nifty futures show a confirmed double top pattern with support at 45,350. Trading strategy suggests short positions at 45,700 and 45,850 with stop-loss at 46,100 and target at 45,350.

Headlines: Swiggy and HDFC Bank Launch Co-Branded Credit Card with Exciting Cashback Offers and Benefits
Description: Swiggy & HDFC Bank partner to launch co-branded credit card offering 10 per cent cashback on Swiggy & 5 per cent on other platforms. Customers get 1 per cent cashback on other spending and 3-month free Swiggy One membership. Cardholders enjoy World Tier Mastercard benefits like free stay & dine, loyalty memberships & more. Apply via Swiggy app or HDFC Bank website.

Headlines: HDFC Bank Partners With Dvara KGFS for Co-Lending Loans to Micro Enterprises - News18
Description: Dvara KGFS, a Chennai-based NBFC, has entered into a co-lending partnership with HDFC Bank to provide capital to micro business

Headlines: Big banks locked in ‘war’ for large corporate loans
Description: India's top four banks (SBI, HDFC Bank, Bank of Baroda, Axis Bank) could account for ~60% of fresh lending to India Inc. Rates for large corporates are competitive, creating a price war since Sep 2021. AAA-rated entities can borrow at 8-8.5% while A-rated entities at 8.5-8.75%. G-Sec rates are 7.07-7.15%. Banks are vying for other business, such as transaction banking, to make up for low loan pricing.

Headlines: Posing As HDFC Bank Employees, Scammers Cheat Bhopal Dentist Of Rs 10 Lakh - News18
Description: The accused impersonated a bank employee when they contacted the dentist from Bhopal, tricking him into revealing his account details.
